solution_line_template: In the bottom half of the igloo, there are {total_rows} rows / {half_divisor} = <<{total_rows}/{half_divisor}={bottom_half_rows}>>{bottom_half_rows} rows of bricks of snow.

So in the bottom half of the igloo, there are {bottom_half_rows} rows * {bricks_per_row_bottom} bricks of snow in each row = <<{bottom_half_rows}*{bricks_per_row_bottom}={total_bricks_bottom_half}>>{total_bricks_bottom_half} bricks of snow.

In the top half of the igloo, there are {bottom_half_rows} rows * {bricks_per_row_top} bricks of snow in each row = <<{bottom_half_rows}*{bricks_per_row_top}={total_bricks_top_half}>>{total_bricks_top_half} bricks of snow.

There is therefore a total of {total_bricks_bottom_half} + {total_bricks_top_half} = <<{total_bricks_bottom_half}+{total_bricks_top_half}={total_bricks_igloo}>>{total_bricks_igloo} bricks of snow in the igloo.
